name: Chocolate Chunk Beet Ice Cream
description: This chocolate chunk beet ice cream is actually like vegan red velvet ice cream. But while many red velvet ice cream recipes call for red food coloring, I used cooked beets instead, which makes it so much healthier!

recipeInstructions.text: Put the cooked beets, the coconut milk, the agave, and the ginger in a food processor and blend until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the cooked beets, the coconut milk, the agave, and the ginger in a food processor and blend until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text:
Ice Cream Machine (recommended): 

Put the beet coconut mixture in your ice cream machine and freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions. Stir in the chocolate chunks and place the ice cream in a freezer-safe container and freeze for another 2 hours in your freezer. Thaw for 5-10 minutes and scoop with an ice cream scoop.
recipeInstructions.name:
Ice Cream Machine (recommended): 

Put the beet coconut mixture in your ice cream machine and freeze according to the manufacturer's instructions. Stir in the chocolate chunks and place the ice cream in a freezer-safe container and freeze for another 2 hours in your freezer. Thaw for 5-10 minutes and scoop with an ice cream scoop.

recipeInstructions.text:
No Machine/No Churn:

Put the beet coconut mixture in a freezer-safe container, stir in the chococalte chunks and freeze for about 4 hours, whisking slightly every 20-30 minutes to avoid it getting too icy. Thaw for 5-10 minutes and scoop with an ice cream scoop.
recipeInstructions.name:
No Machine/No Churn:

Put the beet coconut mixture in a freezer-safe container, stir in the chococalte chunks and freeze for about 4 hours, whisking slightly every 20-30 minutes to avoid it getting too icy. Thaw for 5-10 minutes and scoop with an ice cream scoop.
